channel.title: Grub rescue
channel.description:
I can't boot into windows after uninstalling Ubuntu. It says 'error: no such partition.' with a grub rescue> thing for me to enter a command. I set windows as the main operating system, but I don't think it worked..
I do not have a backup disk of any operating system besides windows xp, and the windows xp one only works for 1 of my computers.

item.title: Grub rescue
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Then i’d suggest burning the system rescue cd, and then chroot into your ubuntu partition, and edit the grub.cfg (or, if it’s using grub2, then doing grub-setup or grub-install should work)

Read full topic
